title: Corporate Governance Practices of Charles & Colvard Ltd

content.text: Charles & Colvard Ltd has a board of directors consisting of seven members. The board is diverse in terms of expertise and experience, with members from various backgrounds including finance, retail, and technology. This diversity ensures a broad range of perspectives and skills to guide the company.

The board of Charles & Colvard Ltd includes a majority of independent directors. These directors have no material relationship with the company and are free from any conflicts of interest that could compromise their decision-making. This promotes unbiased decision-making and protects the interests of shareholders.

Charles & Colvard Ltd has established several committees to enhance corporate governance. These committees include the Audit Committee, Compensation Committee, Governance and Nominating Committee, and Strategic Planning Committee. Each committee focuses on specific areas of governance, ensuring effective oversight and decision-making.

The executive compensation practices of Charles & Colvard Ltd are designed to align the interests of executives with those of shareholders. The compensation packages include a mix of base salary, annual incentives, and long-term incentives such as stock options. These incentives are tied to the company's performance, encouraging executives to work towards the long-term success of the company.

Charles & Colvard Ltd follows a pay-for-performance philosophy, where executive compensation is directly tied to the company's financial and operational performance. This ensures that executives are incentivized to achieve superior results and create value for shareholders.

Charles & Colvard Ltd actively engages with its shareholders through regular communication and transparency. The company provides disclosures on executive compensation and corporate governance practices, allowing shareholders to make informed decisions and hold management accountable.

Charles & Colvard Ltd conducts regular board evaluations to assess the effectiveness and performance of the board and its committees. This evaluation process helps identify areas for improvement and ensures ongoing governance excellence.

Overall, Charles & Colvard Ltd demonstrates strong corporate governance practices through its diverse and independent board, committee structure, aligned executive compensation, shareholder engagement, and board evaluation processes. These practices contribute to effective decision-making, accountability, and the protection of shareholder interests.
